sorular.soru: Can children over 1.35 metres tall still use a child seat?

feedback.metin: Child restraint systems are mandatory for children up to 1.35 metres tall and 18 years of age. While these systems are not required for children over this height, they are still allowed – and often a sensible choice, especially in the front passenger seat. Seat belts are easily adjustable for most adults but can still fall too close to the neck when used by children just over 1.35 metres tall.

sorular.soru: What does this sign mean?

feedback.metin: The L-3 sign indicates a bus and/or tram stop. At a bus or tram stop, you are not allowed to park or stop at the block marking. Is there no block marking? In that case, you are not allowed to park or stop at any point between 12 metres before and 12 metres after the L-3 sign. The only exception is stopping to drop off or pick up passengers. You must drive away immediately afterwards. Waiting is prohibited, as this falls under parking.

sorular.soru: Can you stop here to pick up a hitchhiker?

feedback.metin: You may only stop on the hard shoulder in case of an emergency situation. Picking up a hitchhiker is not an emergency situation.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to stop here to make a phone call?

feedback.metin: Making telephone calls falls under parking. You are not loading and/or unloading goods or picking up or dropping off a passenger. Parking a car in a disabled parking space is only allowed if you (or any passenger) are in possession of a disabled parking permit and parking is directly related to the transport of this disabled person. This is not the case when making a telephone call.

sorular.soru: Do you need a driving licence to drive a moped?
cevaplar: Yes, you must hold an AM driving licence.
Yes, you must hold an A driving licence.
No, you can drive a moped without a licence.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes, you must hold an AM driving licence.

feedback.metin: An AM driving licence is required to drive a moped. When you obtain the B (passenger car) or A (motorcycle) driving licence, you automatically receive the AM licence too.

sorular.soru: The surface of your brake pedal is temporarily slippery due to snow residue. Are you allowed to drive?

feedback.metin: The brake pedal should always have a non-slip surface. Otherwise, your foot may slip off while braking. If there is snow on the brake pedal, you should not drive. Therefore, always remove dirt from your shoes before pressing the pedals. This, of course, also applies to mud, sand, or other things that can reduce skid resistance.

sorular.soru: Do cars use more energy when carrying heavier cargo?

feedback.metin: As soon as weight is added to the car, for example by more people or luggage, your car will use more energy.

sorular.soru: You are driving 100 km/h. Are you allowed to keep driving like this?

feedback.metin: Your following distance is too short. You have to have a minimal following distance of 2 seconds. At 80 km/h this is 44 metres, at 100 km/h this is 55 metres. That is approximately 11 car lengths. You are not allowed to drive like this, this falls under tailgating.

sorular.soru: Can you park your car in a parking space after this sign?

feedback.metin: In a zone where parking is prohibited, you are allowed to park in parking bays or specially designated road sections. These zones can be found in areas where parking outside the parking bays is not desirable.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to park here?

feedback.metin: Parking on the carriageway of a priority road outside built-up areas is prohibited. However, you are not on the carriageway here, but in the verge. You are therefore allowed to park here.

sorular.soru: Is it allowed to enter this road?

feedback.metin: This is a dead-end road. You may drive here, but you must leave the road the same way you entered.

sorular.soru: Can a car being towed carry passengers?
cevaplar: Yes, but only as many passengers as there are seats.
Yes, but only if there is no room left in the towing car.
No, only a driver is allowed in a towed car.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes, but only if there is no room left in the towing car.

feedback.metin: If a car breaks down and must be towed, passengers are only allowed in the towed vehicle if there are no seats left in towing vehicle. There should always be as many passengers as possible in the towing vehicle.

sorular.soru: Can you drive through here if you cannot merge yet?

feedback.metin: Hard shoulders are only intended for use in emergencies. Merging is not an emergency and using the hard shoulder to merge is not allowed. Acceleration lanes in the Netherlands are of sufficient length that you have enough space to merge correctly and do not need to use the hard shoulder.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this light is on?
cevaplar: Stop and check the coolant level.

feedback.metin: This light comes on in most cars when the outside temperature is 4 degrees Celsius or lower. At these temperatures, there is a risk of slippery conditions. It is therefore wise to drive extra carefully.

sorular.soru: What is the energy label for the most energy-efficient passenger cars?

feedback.metin: New passenger cars have an energy label. This label indicates how much energy they use and what their CO2 emissions are. Label A is the most economical and label G the least economical.

sorular.soru: When is the best time to check the coolant level?
cevaplar: After you have been driving for an hour.

feedback.metin: Coolant is very hot and subjected to high pressure during and after driving. The best time to check the coolant level is when the car is stationary, before driving.

sorular.soru: Should you stop?

feedback.metin: The level crossing bars are raised, and the lights are off. You may enter a level crossing if you can continue straight ahead. Stopping on the road section between two or more tracks is prohibited. If you can continue immediately, you are not required to stop. Always approach a level crossing at an appropriate speed.

sorular.soru: Under the 2toDrive scheme, are you also allowed to drive outside the Netherlands under supervision?

feedback.metin: If you fall under the 2toDrive scheme, you are only allowed to drive in the Netherlands under supervision. In that case, the driving licence is not valid abroad.

sorular.soru: What should you do if you have a breakdown while the rush-hour lane is open and you cannot reach the lay-by?
cevaplar: Park as far to the right as possible, turn on your hazard lights, call 112, and warn oncoming traffic.
Park as far to the right as possible, turn on your hazard lights, stand behind the crash barrier, and call 112.
Park as far to the right as possible, turn on your hazard lights, call 112, and wait in the vehicle for the emergency services.
sorular.dogruCevap: Park as far to the right as possible, turn on your hazard lights, stand behind the crash barrier, and call 112.

feedback.metin: Hard shoulders are used as rush-hour lanes, so if you break down while the rush hour lane is open, you cannot use the hard shoulder. Besides the rush-hour lane, there is a breakdown layby every 100 to 500 metres. If possible, try to reach this layby in the event of a breakdown. If you cannot reach the layby, park your vehicle as far to the right of the road as possible, on the lane or in the verge. Switch on your hazard lights and stand behind the crash barrier or on the verge, then call 112 for help. Do not attempt to warn oncoming traffic as this may be dangerous.

sorular.soru: What should you do here?

feedback.metin: The J-20 sign indicates a skidding hazard, so you should adjust your speed. Breaking is not advised, as this increases the risk of skidding. If you do skid, do not accelerate or brake, and steer in the desired direction.

sorular.soru: What is the biggest risk here?
cevaplar: That the white passenger car does not see the red passenger car.
That the lorry is going to take the bend too wide.
That the red passenger car does not see the white passenger car.
sorular.dogruCevap: That the white passenger car does not see the red passenger car.

feedback.metin: The pre-sorted lorry is blocking the white passenger car’s view, so they cannot see the red passenger car. The white car must give way to the red car. As he cannot see the red passenger car, the driver may wrongly assume that the road is clear and continue driving, increasing the risk of a collision.

sorular.soru: How much tread does a winter tyre need in order to function optimally?

feedback.metin: A minimum tread depth of 4 millimetres is recommended to make the best use of winter tyres. For summer tyres this is 2 millimetres. The legal minimum for all tyres is 1.6 millimetres, with no distinction being made between summer and winter tyres.

sorular.soru: What speed limit applies after this sign?

feedback.metin: You just passed the 'end of built-up area' sign, and the sign with the diagonal black stripes indicates the end of all bans indicated by traffic signs. The speed limit here is 80 km/h.

sorular.soru: Should you use your indicator here?

feedback.metin: If you want to overtake on a motorway, you must use your indicator to move either left or right.

sorular.soru: In which situation should you expect drivers from the left?

feedback.metin: In situation A, the intersecting road is a one-way street. On this road, drivers are only allowed to drive in the direction of the arrow. In this case, you should expect drivers from the right, but not from the left. In situation B, you approach a normal road, which may be entered from both directions. So here you should expect drivers from the left.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive at 100 km/h here?

feedback.metin: Speed limits apply under optimal conditions. When conditions deteriorate, for example, due to bad weather or a poor road surface, you must adapt your speed to the circumstances.

sorular.soru: Is it mandatory to turn left here?

feedback.metin: The sign indicates the direction for through traffic. You are not required to follow that direction. The sign only indicates that, if you want to follow the through route, it is best to turn left.

sorular.soru: How should a seat belt be worn?
cevaplar: Tighten the belt until there is no slack.
Fasten the belt as loosely as possible.
Fasten the belt as tightly as possible.
sorular.dogruCevap: Tighten the belt until there is no slack.

feedback.metin: When putting on a seat belt, pull on the belt until there is no slack between the belt and your body. Excessively loose seat belts are unsafe, and excessively tight seat belts are uncomfortable.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the wheelchair user?
cevaplar: Yes, disabled persons always have right of way.

feedback.metin: You are not required to give way to wheelchair users if they want to cross the carriageway. They do not fall under the category of "persons with decreased mobility". If a wheelchair user uses the pavement or wants to cross the carriageway, they must behave like a pedestrian. When crossing a pedestrian crossing, the wheelchair user must, of course, be given right of way.

sorular.soru: You made a mistake and actually want to go straight. Are you still allowed to change lanes?

feedback.metin: You are still allowed to change lanes here.

sorular.soru: Is a speed pedelec a motor carriage?

feedback.metin: Motor carriages are any and all vehicles that run on a motor. These vehicles do not use tracks (like trains, metros, and trams). A bicycle with pedal assistance is not a motor carriage, but a speed pedelec is. A trolleybus is also a motor carriage.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to stop here?

feedback.metin: Stopping on the right-hand side of the road is prohibited. You are allowed to stop on the left-hand side of the road.

sorular.soru: Are horse riders allowed here?

feedback.metin: The G-9 sign indicates a bridle path, which horse riders are required to use. If there is no bridle path, riders must use the verge or the carriageway.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive like this?

feedback.metin: The passenger car’s lighting is not fully visible. The bicycle carrier must therefore be equipped with lighting to compensate for this – two red rear lights, two red brake lights, two red retroreflectors, and two amber indicators.

sorular.soru: What colour retroreflectors can be found on the rear of a trailer?

feedback.metin: The rear of a trailer is always equipped with red retroreflectors. In many cases, these retroreflectors are triangular. While this is mandatory in some countries, is it optional in the Netherlands. Trailers are also equipped with amber yellow retroreflectors on the sides and white retroreflectors on the front.

sorular.soru: Must every passenger car be assigned a vehicle identification number?

feedback.metin: Every passenger car has its own vehicle identification number (VIN). This number, which is included on the vehicle registration certificate, is stamped on the car’s chassis or frame and must be clearly legible.

sorular.soru: Who are you not allowed to hinder while exiting a vehicle?

feedback.metin: You must not hinder anyone else when exiting your vehicle.

sorular.soru: You want to turn right, and so does the bus behind you. Can you drive on?

feedback.metin: If there are no special bus lanes, buses use the normal lanes. Such a shared lane can be provided with both a normal traffic light and a public transport light (nine-eye). Only the driver of a public bus bus may follow this nine-eye light and in this case, drive through the red light intended for you. You are not allowed to do this; you must wait for the red light to turn green, even if you hold up the bus in doing so.

sorular.soru: Can you be banned from driving for 24 hours if you are caught driving under the influence of drugs?

feedback.metin: You can be banned from driving for up to 24 hours if you are caught driving under the influence of drugs. Police are also authorised to confiscate your licence for this violation.

sorular.soru: Can the moped drive here?

feedback.metin: If there is a cycle/moped path, the moped rider is required to use it.

sorular.soru: Are you pre-sorted correctly?

feedback.metin: You are pre-sorted correctly along the right-hand side of the carriageway. This road is equipped with a cycle suggestion lane, which you are allowed to drive on.

sorular.soru: What should you do when this light comes on?
cevaplar: Drive on to a safe stop and refill the engine oil immediately.
Stop as soon as possible and check the oil level, or call the breakdown service.
Drive on to a safe stop and check the oil level.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop as soon as possible and check the oil level, or call the breakdown service.

feedback.metin: If this light comes on, you must stop as soon as possible as it indicates a problem with the oil pressure. If you continue driving, the engine may break down entirely. If it is safe to do so, check the oil yourself. If you cannot do this safely, for example because you are on a hard shoulder, call the (breakdown) emergency service.
